business.headline: The Rs 1 crore question: Should you invest in stocks or buy a home?For India's middle class, owning a home is not just a financial goal. It is security. It is respect. It is stability for the family. Many parents believe a rented house means uncertainty, while a home of your own means safety.

Property deals under Rs 20 lakh? PAN may not be needed from April 1At present, PAN must be quoted when buying or selling immovable property, such as a house, flat, or plot, if the transaction value exceeds Rs 10 lakh.

Deepinder Goyal wins EY Entrepreneur Of The Year 2025 awardDeepinder Goyal was recognised for his focus on innovation, strong operations and long-term thinking. The jury also noted that his businesses have created thousands of jobs for youth and gig workers and supported a wider ecosystem of entrepreneurs across the country.

Love swiping your credit card? Here's how to use it without falling into a debt trapMore Indians are now swiping their credit cards, though most have not learned the habits needed to stay out of debt. This article shows the mistakes people make and the simple habits that help.
Sensex, Nifty open higher buoyed by IT stocksThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 53.27 points to 82,329.34, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 33.90 points to 25,516.40 as of 9:35 am.

Sensex, Nifty opening: Will stock market rise or fall today?Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,676 at 8:00 am, suggesting that the Nifty 50 may open above Wednesday's closing level of 25,482.5. The early signal points to a mild positive start for the day.

8th Pay Commission website: What's inside and how employees can share viewsWith the launch of the 8th Pay Commission portal, central government employees can now track updates, explore past pay recommendations, and share their suggestions. Have you checked the website yet?

Destroyed my life: Indian CEO sells firm, quits Sweden, blames xenophobiaWhat was meant to be a startup success story in Sweden has ended in an anguished exit for Indian entrepreneur Abhijith Nag Balasubramanyam. Ten months after founding a company, he has been forced to sell his business and return to India. What's behind the move? What challenges did he face? Read on to find out.
Sensex, Nifty erase early gains to end marginally higher; RIL down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 50.15 points to close at 82,276.07, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 57.85 points to end at 25,482.50.

Why your Rs 1.2 lakh salary still feels tight even with just Rs 55,000 EMIsWith a Rs 1.2 lakh monthly income and Rs 55,000 in EMIs, you would expect to have enough left for savings and comfort. But many people still feel financially stretched. Are hidden fixed expenses quietly consuming your income?

With AI hurting IT sector, what's the smarter bet: Stocks or IT mutual funds?While AI fears have driven the sharp fall in IT stocks, the correction has also reset valuations, prompting some long-term investors to see a potential entry opportunity.

No more hidden charges? RBI orders banks to remove misleading app tricksThe RBI's move aims to ensure customers are not misled into buying products or paying charges without proper awareness. Banks will also be barred from bundling financial products together without clear approval from the customer.

Gold crosses Rs 1.61 lakh, silver nears Rs 2.7 lakh in fresh rally: Should you buy?Precious metals are back in focus as gold climbs above Rs 1.61 lakh and silver approaches Rs 2.7 lakh. The steady rise has sparked fresh interest among investors, raising the key question, i.e., is this the right time to buy?

Global economy heading towards 2008-like crisis due to AI? Jamie Dimon answersJamie Dimon, JPMorgan CEO, said that some lenders and financial players are doing "dumb things" to make money in the current market environment, which he described as risky and uncertain.

Infosys, HCLTech, TCS rise up to 4%: Why are IT stocks rising today?IT stocks may still be under pressure, but today's rebound shows confidence returning. The clash between AI anxiety and long-term opportunity is reshaping the narrative, pulling investors back into one of India's most-watched sectors.

Waaree Energies shares fall 15%: What triggered the sharp fall today?Waaree Energy share price: Over the past six months, the stock has declined by Rs 464.50, or 14.74%. However, on a one-year basis, it is still up by Rs 417.85, or 18.42%, according to the latest data.

Sensex gains 500 points: Why is stock market rising today?The S&P BSE Sensex rose 564.63 points to 82,790.45. The NSE Nifty50 gained 167.00 points to 25,591.65 as of 9:28 am. Both indices were up by over 0.5% in early trade.
Sensex, Nifty rally in early trade led by IT stocksThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 515.54 points to 82,741.46, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 181.95 points to 25,606.60 as of 11:19 am.

Sensex, Nifty trading setup: Will stock market fall again today?Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,671.5 at 8:00 am. This suggests that the benchmark Nifty 50 may open above Tuesday's closing level of 25,424.65.

India-Israel free trade talks kick off in Delhi ahead of PM Modi's visit to IsraelAhead of PM Modi's visit to Israel on Wednesday, India and Israel began the first round of negotiations for a proposed Free Trade Agreement in New Delhi.

entertainment.headline: Konkona Sen Sharma on how Accused avoids default tropes on homosexuality Konkona Sen Sharma said that homosexual characters aren't seen in films unless it is dealt with 'as an issue'. She also opened up on the portrayal of 'differently-abled' characters in cinema.

Hema Malini denies rift rumours with Sunny, Bobby; cites Dharmendra's strong values Hema Malini spoke about the rumours of a rift with Sunny and Bobby Deol, insisting that the family remains united under the values Dharmendra instilled in them. She also opened up about skipping Border 2's screening.

Wear your cake and eat it too: Check out Uorfi Javed's viral style statement Uorfi Javed grabbed attention at a party in a quirky cake dress, even taking a bite of her edible outfit. Watch the viral video of her latest bold fashion statement.

Jyotika praises Thaai Kizhavi for its progressive take on womanhood Jyotika has commended the upcoming Tamil comedy drama Thaai Kizhavi for its portrayal of women and its progressive message, as the film prepares for its theatrical release on February 27.

Why BTS' Jungkook pushing back on smoking criticism is more than a viral moment Jungkook opened up about quitting smoking and addressed criticism during his recent livestream. He also defended BigHit Music and shared excitement about BTS's upcoming ARIRANG album.

Priyanka Chopra played Mahamrityunjay mantra during Malti's premature birth Priyanka Chopra Jonas opened up about her experience after the premature birth of her daughter, Malti. She spoke about the challenges of her daughter's extended stay in the NICU and the pressure to make the news public.

K-drama cake, Gangnam Style, Antakshari: Inside Virosh's pre-wedding Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna's pre-wedding celebrations honoured the couple's personal preferences. The couple got married on February 26.

HBO renews thriller series Industry for fifth and final chapter HBO has confirmed that Industry will return for a fifth and final season, bringing an end to the drama series created by Mickey Down and Konrad Kay after a decade-long run.

Rashmika Mandanna, Vijay Deverakonda now married; second ceremony in evening Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda got married in a traditional Andhra wedding ceremony on Thursday morning. The couple will perform another ceremony to honour the bride's family.

Salim Khan's health improving after medical procedure, confirms Aamir Khan Aamir Khan confirmed that veteran screenwriter Salim Khan is steadily recovering, adding that the family and members of the film fraternity continue to offer constant support. He said prayers are ongoing for his complete recovery.

Rashmika-Vijay walk hand-in-hand in 1st photo from their pre-wedding festivities A photo of actors Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna from their sangeet ceremony has drawn attention online. The photo offers fans a look into the close-knit celebration as the two get married in Udaipur today.

Davinder Gill on Kohrra 2, bonded labour in Punjab and breaking stereotypes Actor Davinder Gill impressed as constable Aujla in Kohrra Season 2. In an exclusive chat, he spoke about the show breaking stereotypes, working with Barun Sobti and his journey on the show.
Bridgerton Season 4: Anthony and Kate re-enter the Ton with their newborn A first look at Bridgerton Season 4 Part 2 revealed Anthony and Kate's long-awaited return with a surprising new addition.

Rashmika Mandanna's Pushpa dance at Sangeet leaves Vijay spellbound Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna are celebrating their wedding with an intimate three-day event at ITC Mementos in Udaipur. Amid the festivities, a special gesture from the bride left guests swooning over the couple's chemistry.

Selena Gomez reacts after Benny Blanco's viral dirty feet moment Selena Gomez appeared to addressed the backlash after Benny Blanco's viral podcast moment sparked heated debate online. Here's what happened and why fans are divided.

Geetha Govindam, Dear Comrade: ViRosh romance through screen stories together Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna's love story in real life grew with their professional collaborations.
Geetha Govindam is where it started, Dear Comrade was the film where it grew, and the couple will be seen in Ranabaali after wedding.

Kangana's plea to quash 2021 FIR in Didda film case can be withdrawn: High Court Bombay High Court on Wednesday permitted Kangana Ranaut to withdraw a plea seeking to quash an FIR registered in 2021 against her.

Delhi to host first International Film Festival from March 25 The capital will host the first International Film Festival Delhi (IFFD) from March 25 to 31, featuring over 125 Indian and international films.

Palaash Muchhal gets support from Daisy Shah amid wedding row: He's a very good person Palaash Muchhal has received support from Daisy Shah amid the controversy surrounding his cancelled wedding with Smriti Mandhana. Daisy described him as a "very good" person and praised his grounded family background.

general news.headline: How an NCERT chapter on judiciary corruption invited Supreme Court fury, banA Social Science textbook recently released by NCERT, which carried a section on 'corruption in judiciary', has the Supreme Court seeing red. The court, which described it as a deep-rooted conspiracy, has not only barred the sharing of the content but also banned the book altogether.

Live: PM Modi visits Holocaust museum with Netanyahu, to meet Israeli President soonPM Modi in Israel Live Updates: In an attempt to strengthen bilateral defence and trade ties against the backdrop of ongoing tensions in the Middle East, including the worsening relationship between the United States and Iran, Prime Minister Narendra Modi landed in Israel on Wednesday. His first day was marked by a speech in the Knesset and later a grand dinner with his Israeli counterpart, Benjamin Netanyahu. On the second day, the Indian PM is expected to visit the Yad Vashem Holocaust memorial and hold key discussions with Netanyahu and the President of Israel, Isaac Herzog.

Chief Justice's 5 big orders as Supreme Court bans NCERT book amid judiciary rowThe Supreme Court has issued sweeping directions to NCERT over the withdrawn Class 8 Social Science book. From an immediate ban and seizure of copies to seeking names of authors and meeting minutes, Chief Justice of India Surya Kant has laid down strict compliance steps for the council and state education departments.

Live: Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda are now marriedRashmika-Vijay Udaipur Wedding Live Updates: The wedding celebrations of Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda are underway in Udaipur, with early Instagram glimpses pointing to a celebration that marries charm with refined elegance.

Stephen Hawking seen sandwiched between bikini-clad women; family says caregiversA newly surfaced photo from the Epstein files showed Stephen Hawking lounging with two bikini-clad women, holding a cocktail.

Jamaat chief blasts Bangladesh President, reveals Yunus-Islamists nexusDays after Bangladesh President Mohammed Shahabuddin revealed the unconstitutional actions of the Muhammad Yunus-led interim regime and how he was treated by it, Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami Ameer Shafiqur Rahman criticised the former. This is how Rahman's criticism of the President reveals the tacit relationship between the Yunus regime and Bangladesh's Islamist groups.

Bahut shandaar: Netanyahu's Indian attire at dinner meet gets PM praiseWith a warm posture and hands outstretched, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was seen wearing a traditional Indian jacket as he warmly greeted Prime Minister Narendra Modi before a private dinner in Israel. "Bahut hi shandaar (Splendid!)," reciprocated PM Modi.

Ambanis host Arjun Tendulkar, Saaniya Chandhok and family in Jamnagar before weddingBefore the big wedding next month, Ambanis and Tendulkars came together to bless the couple Arjun Tendulkar and Saaniya Chandhok in Jamnagar.

Supreme Court bans NCERT book amid judiciary chapter row; Centre says sorryThe NCERT judiciary chapter row escalated after the CJI sharply criticised the content as a grave matter, warning that the Supreme Court would not permit any attempt to defame or undermine the integrity of the judiciary.

Woman, 3 daughters found with slit throats in Delhi home; hunt on for husbandPolice were confronted with a horrifying scene when they entered the North Delhi home: four bodies lay scattered across the room, covered in blood. Canada changes tack on linking India to 'crimes' ahead of PM Carney's visitIn a reversal of former Canadian PM Justin Trudeau's stance, the Mark Carney government has said that India has no role in violent crimes on Canadian soil. Ahead of Carney's visit to India, senior Canadian officials said Ottawa is no longer concerned about interference or repression by Indian agents.

sports.headline: SL vs NZ: Sangakkara demands urgent reforms after Sri Lanka's T20 World Cup exit T20 World Cup: Kumar Sangakkara called for urgent reform on all levels after Sri Lanka's early T20 World Cup exit. He warned that unless Sri Lanka adapt to the modern game quickly, the gap between them and leading teams will only continue to grow.

T20 World Cup: No dew drama in IND vs ZIM? US chemical to be used at Chepauk T20 World Cup: Dew may not play factor during the India vs Zimbabwe clash at Chepauk on Thursday, with the Tamil Nadu Cricket Association using a US-imported chemical to tackle with the moisture during the game.

Vinicuis gets his revenge as Real Madrid knock Benfica out of Champions League Vinicius Jr sealed Real Madrid's 3-1 win with a decisive late goal against Benfica. Days after off-field controversy, the Brazilian shifted the focus back to football and guided Madrid into the Champions League Round of 16.

Jammu and Kashmir captain Paras Dogra fined for headbutt row in Ranji Trophy final Ranji Trophy Final: Paras Dogra is set to be fined after his on-field clash with KV Aneesh during the Ranji Trophy final. The flashpoint briefly sparked chaos but did little to stop Jammu and Kashmir's march to 584.

Dube's bowling questioned, called a batter and not an all-rounder by ex-IND star T20 World Cup: Mohammed Kaif isn't convinced with Shivam Dube's capabilities as a bowler, saying that he is a batter and not an all-rounder. Dube has been expensive with the ball this year for India.

With the victory over the co-hosts, New Zealand are now in a strong position to secure a semi-final spot.

Chennai metro steps up for IND vs ZIM: Free tickets for fans to Chepauk Chennai Metro Rail Limited will provide complimentary metro rides on Thursday, February 26, for those attending the India vs Zimbabwe Super 8 match, with match tickets doubling as metro passes. The initiative includes extended services to midnight and special operational measures near the Chepauk stadium.

Sri Lanka job done, but New Zealand cannot underestimate England: Rachin Ravindra T20 World Cup: Rachin Ravindra said New Zealand cannot afford to take England lightly despite beating Sri Lanka. With a semi-final spot at stake, their final Super 8 clash will decide how far this campaign goes.

India keep close watch as South Africa, West Indies aim for semis spotsSouth Africa and West Indies face off in a crucial Super 8 match at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad. The winner will take a big step towards the T20 World Cup 2026 semi-finals, with net run rate playing a key role.

South Africa wary of explosive West Indies threat in Super 8: Keshav MaharajT20 World Cup 2026, SA vs WI: Keshav Maharaj, speaking to the reporters before the Super 8 clash on Thursday in Ahmedabad, said that South Africa are wary of the threat West Indies pose.

West Indies have flown under the radar, but have nothing to prove: Floyd ReiferT20 World Cup, SA vs WI: Speaking to the reporters before their Super 8 clash against South Africa in Ahmedabad, West Indies batting coach Floyd Reifer said that the team hasn't got enough attention of late, but they don't have any point to prove.

Smriti Mandhana, Jemimah Rodrigues in Women's Bangladesh Premier League? BCB opens upThe BCB has stated that Indian cricketers are welcome to participate in the inaugural edition of the Women's Bangladesh Premier League. At present, the Indian players are in Australia, competing in a multi-format series against the hosts.

India have got home advantage, but pressure does funny things to teams: Ryan BurlT20 World Cup 2026, IND vs ZIM: Speaking to the reporters, all-rounder Ryan Burl said that both India and Zimbabwe will be under pressure going into their Super 8 clash on Thursday at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai.

New Zealand knock Sri Lanka out of T20 World Cup, Pakistan in huge trouble as wellT20 World Cup, NZ vs SL: Mitchell Santner's New Zealand knocked Sri Lanka out of the competition with a dominating 61-run win on Wednesday at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo. Rachin Ravindra was the star for the Black Caps with four wickets.

Samson in, Tilak out? In do-or-die clash, India consider big changesIndia vs Zimbabwe: The Indian team are likely to make important changes in their playing XI in their do-or-die clash against Zimbabwe. Sanju Samson is likely to get a look-in.

Amelia Kerr makes dream start to New Zealand captaincy era with special all-round showNZW vs ZIMW, 1st T20I: Amelia Kerr delivered a stunning all-round performance on Wednesday, smashing a 51-ball century and returning figures of 4-0-14-2 as New Zealand defeated Zimbabwe by 92 runs at Seddon Park in Hamilton.

T20 World Cup: Zimbabwe's Sikandar Raza 100 per cent fit for must-win India clashZimbabwe leg-spinner Ryan Burl brushed aside any fitness concerns around captain Sikandar Raza, confirming that the talismanic all-rounder is "100 per cent" fit for their must-win Super 8 clash against India in the T20 World Cup.

India have to be positive, handle pressure to win T20 World Cup: Batting coachHere is the full transcript of India batting coach Sitanshu Kotak's press conference ahead of their second Super 8 clash against India in ICC Men's T20 World Cup in Chennai.

Pakistan Women's batter reprimanded by ICC after outburst against South AfricaSAW vs PAKW, 1st ODI: Pakistan Women's batter Sidra Amin was reprimanded for her outburst following her dismissal in the first ODI against South Africa at the Mangaung Oval in Bloemfontein.

Adaptation is key: South Africa's Maharaj plays down Ahmedabad's familiarity advantageSA vs WI, T20 World Cup 2026 Super 8s: South Africa spinner Keshav Maharaj says adaptation, not venue familiarity, will be key when the Proteas face West Indies in a crucial T20 World Cup Super 8 clash in Ahmedabad on Thursday.

NZ vs SL Super 8 Live: New Zealand knock Sri Lanka out of World CupNew Zealand (NZ) vs Sri Lanka (SL), T20 World Cup Super 8 Highlights: SL (107/8 in 20 ovs) lose to NZ by 61 runs. Sri Lanka have been knocked out of the T20 World Cup. With the huge win, New Zealand take a big step towards semi-finals. Pakistan are all but out of the tournament as well.

Ranji Trophy final: J&K tighten grip on bad light-hit Day 2 against KarnatakaJammu and Kashmir deepened Karnataka's troubles by piling up 527 for six, taking firm control of the Ranji Trophy final before bad light brought an early end to Day 2 on Wednesday.

Will Samson play vs Zimbabwe? Batting coach hints at change in batting orderT20 World Cup: Will India change their batting line-up in their do-or-die clash? After India's disaster against South Africa. India batting coach Sitanshu Kotak hinted that there might be changes in the batting order.

Abhishek Sharma retains top rank despite poor form, Ishan Kishan breaks into top 5Star opener Abhishek Sharma retained his No. 1 spot despite his horrible run in the ongoing T20 World Cup. At the same time, wicketkeeper-batter Ishan Kishan stormed into the top five of the latest International Cricket Council (ICC) Men's T20I Player Rankings.

Gukesh slams Kramnik over cheating allegations in chess: Not supportive of itWorld chess champion D Gukesh distances himself from Vladimir Kramnik's allegations of widespread cheating in chess, emphasising his opposition to unethical play but urging the chess community to avoid overreacting.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
